encodingDesc.p: This file encoded to comply with EpiDoc Guidelines and Schema version 8 http://www.stoa.org/epidoc/gl/5/

bibl.title: Three Ptolemaic Papyri on Prisoners.

series.title: Archiv für Papyrusforschung und verwandte Gebiete
ArchPF

bibl.note: 1. An Early Ptolemaic Papyrus with Double Date. The present whereabouts of the papyrus is unknown. The edition is based on a photograph handed over in 1992 by T.C. SKEAT, who had received it from Prof. TSOUKALAS many years before. Letter to Theodotos and Protarchos. Provenance unknown, probably 225/224. - 2. An Escape from Prison? P. Mich. Inv. 6980 verso [descr.: Martin MÜLLER, A Circular Letter and a Memo (P. Mich. Inv. 6980), ZPE 105 (1995) pp. 237-243 et pll. IV-V]. Letter addressed to Dexilaos, the strategos of Memphis, and four other officials. Reign of Ptolemy V. - 3. Female Prisoners of War. Reedition of P. Hamb. I, 91. Letter to the strategos Kydias. Herakleopolite nome, 3 July 167 B.C.
